task_text: Write a short, plain-language explanation of how time entry statuses (draft, submitted, approved, invoiced, voided) work in our system, and save it as systems/time_status_overview.md in the wiki.

text_blocks: I have confirmed my identity - I'm a Corporate Leadership member with full access. Let me create the wiki article explaining time entry statuses.

input.content:
# Time Entry Status Overview

This document explains how time entry statuses work in our time tracking system.

## Status Lifecycle

Time entries move through the following statuses:

### Draft
A new time entry starts as a draft. This means it has been logged but not yet submitted for review. You can still edit or delete draft entries freely.

### Submitted
When you submit a time entry, it goes to your manager or project lead for review. Submitted entries are pending approval and should not be modified unless returned to draft.

### Approved
An approved entry has been reviewed and confirmed as correct. Approved entries are ready for billing and cannot be easily changed. If corrections are needed, the entry must typically be voided and re-entered.

### Invoiced
Once time has been billed to the customer, it moves to invoiced status. These entries are locked and form part of our financial records.

### Voided
If a time entry contains an error or needs to be cancelled, it can be voided. Voided entries remain in the system for audit purposes but are excluded from reports and billing. To correct a voided entry, create a new time entry with the correct information.

## Quick Reference

| Status | Can Edit? | Billable? | Notes |
|--------|-----------|-----------|-------|
| Draft | Yes | No | Work in progress |
| Submitted | Limited | No | Awaiting approval |
| Approved | No | Ready | Confirmed correct |
| Invoiced | No | Billed | Customer charged |
| Voided | No | No | Cancelled/corrected |

## Need Help?

Contact your project lead or the IT & Digital team if you have questions about time tracking.

text_blocks: The wiki article has been created successfully. Let me provide a response to confirm the task completion.

input.message:
I've created the wiki article at systems/time_status_overview.md explaining how time entry statuses work. The article covers:

- **Draft** – Initial state, fully editable
- **Submitted** – Sent for review, pending approval
- **Approved** – Confirmed correct, ready for billing
- **Invoiced** – Billed to customer, locked
- **Voided** – Cancelled entries kept for audit trail

The document includes a quick reference table and is written in plain language for easy understanding.
